title: Over the hills
text:
Home » travel » Over the hills GETAWAYS   30, 2015 1:00 am 
Panviman Chiang Mai Spa Resort Perched high in the hills and surrounded by tropical forests, flower gardens and orchards, Panviman Chiang Mai Spa Resort is now offering a Magical Retreat Package. CHIANG MAI Over the hills Perched high in the hills and surrounded by tropical forests, flower gardens and orchards, Panviman Chiang Mai Spa Resort is now offering a Magical Retreat Package. It covers two nights for two people, daily breakfast, welcome drink and cold towel, welcome fruit basket, one Thai set dinner, pre-dinner cocktail, complimentary 60 Minutes Stress Release Massage, round trip transfer service by private van from/to Chiang Mai airport and Wi-Fi. Rates vary from Bt11,500 to Bt29,600 depending on room type. The package is valid through October 31 Call (053) 879540-50. Visit www.Panviman.com. BANGKOK Pretty in pink The Royal Orchid Sheraton Hotel & Towers supports Breast Cancer Awareness month throughout October with a "Sweet in Pink High Tea" at Bt750 per set. Fifty per cent of the income will be donated to the Queen Sirikit Centre for Breast Cancer at King Chulalongkorn Memorial Hospital. The High Tea set includes beetroot and salmon tartlet, vol-au-vent with pink cream cheese, crudites with a pink crab and dill dip, pink macaroons, raspberries eclairs and much more. The tea is served from 2 to 5pm and is available all this month. Call (02) 266 9214 or e-mail: events.rosh@sheraton.com. Sensuous scrubs The Okura Spa at the Okura Prestige Bangkok is offering a range of Rejuvenating Body Scrubs that nourish the skin and provide essential healing qualities. Expert therapists help to select the scrub powder, based on each guest's preferences and individual needs, before mixing the selection with base cream and essential oil. The three specialist scrub powders are Siamese Sesame, Mixed Rice and Tropical Fruit and the 50-minute tailor-made treatments, priced at Bt1,800, are available every day from 10 to 10 until November30. Call (02) 687 9000 or e-mail: spa@okurabangkok.com. PATTAYA Fun for all the family Siam Bayshore hotel invites couples and families to relax with its Fun & Adventure Package. The package includes one night stay in a Tropical Deluxe room, entry to Cartoon Network Water Park, welcome fruit basket, American breakfast buffet, complimentary transportation to Water Park (subject to availability), 25 per-cent discount off best available rate for extended nights, and late checkout (subject to availability). Prices start from Bt5,500 per couple, Bt6,500 per couple with one child and Bt7,500 per couple with two children. Call (038) 428 678 or e-mail: siambayshore@sukosolhotels.com. KRABI Hot nights in cool Krabi Rayavadee Krabi is offering the new Rayavadee Experience, which combines four nights in a Deluxe Pavilion for two persons, daily breakfast, three dinners for two at any of the resort's restaurants with a 75-minute massage treatment for two at the luxurious Rayavadee Spa and a choice of either a Thai cooking class or a private half day rock climbing lesson for two. The offer also includes round trip car and boat transfers from/to Krabi International Airport and complimentary use of non-motorised water sports equipment. The package is at Bt67,000 and is valid through October 31. Call (662) 301 1861 or e-mail: reservation@rayavadee.com Visit www.Rayavadee.com. HONG KONG Celebration in suds Passengers travelling on the newly chartered route of Lufthansa Airways' A380 from Frankfurt to Hong Kong on October 24 will be granted free entry to the Marco Polo German Bierfest 2015 from October 25 to 27 by simply presenting their boarding pass at the venue entrance to experience Hong Kong's longest-running outdoor Oktoberfest. Check it out at www.GBFKH.com. 17 Viewed
